required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Optical Coherence Tomography in Staging Patients With Upper Tract Urothelial Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Staging of Upper Tract Urothelial Cancer With Optical Coherence Tomography

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This clinical trial studies how well optical coherence tomography works in staging patients with upper-tract urothelial carcinomas. Staging describes the severity of a person's cancer based on the size and/or extent (reach) of the original (primary) tumor and whether or not cancer has spread in the body. It also helps the doctor plan the appropriate treatment. Optical coherence tomography is a procedure that uses infrared light waves to give three-dimensional pictures of structures inside tissues and organs. The pictures are made by a computer linked to the light source. Optical coherence tomography may be effective in staging patients with upper-tract urothelial carcinomas.

detailed_description.textblock:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVES:
I. To test the feasibility and imaging ability of optical coherence tomography (OCT) to stage upper-tract urothelial carcinomas (UTUC).
OUTLINE:
Patients undergo optical coherence tomography over 10-15 minutes.
After completion of study, patients are followed up at 3 months.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of optical coherence tomography (OCT) images in staging upper-tract urothelial carcinomas (UTUC)
primary_outcome.description: Feasibility defined as the ability to relate the features associated with cancerous tissues in pathohistological analysis to the features in OCT images

secondary_outcome.description: Number of cancerous images with at least one feature different from normal pathology slide

arm_group.description: Patients undergo optical coherence tomography over 10-15 minutes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients must have radiographic evidence of upper tract urothelial cancer by computed tomography (CT), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) or intravenous pyelogram (IVP) in order to undergo this procedure
- Patient who will undergo standard of care clinical staging for UTUC
- Patient ability to read and comprehend the informed consent document
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient who has a contraindication to endoscopy
- Patient who is pregnant
